alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 3:58PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Warm Temperatures Through Friday Afternoon Followed By Sharp Cooling over the Weekend... Strong high pressure over the Interior is causing mostly sunny skies and warmer temperatures today, that will continue into Friday. Highs will be in the upper 30s to upper 40s today, and near 40 on Friday. Lows will be in the teens and 20s. A strong cold front north of the Arctic Coast today will move south over the Northeast Eastern Interior Friday afternoon, and then south across the Eastern Interior Friday night. This will bring much colder temperatures with highs only in the 20s this weekend, along with strong winds and snow. The cold temperatures will continue into early next week. Expect northeast winds gusting to 30 mph to spread over the Interior Friday night and Saturday, with winds likely lasting into Monday. Stronger gusts to 40 mph reduced visibility in blowing snow will develop through the Brooks Range Passes starting Friday afternoon, and over the Interior Highway Summits of the Steese and Elliott Highways starting late Friday night, with the blowing snow continuing into Sunday night. This front will bring a chance of snow to the Eastern Interior from Friday afternoon through Sun, with snow likely over most areas from Fairbanks south and east from Friday evening through Saturday night. Between 1 and 4 inches of snow possible, heaviest along north slopes of the White Mountains and along the Alaska Range. There could additional 2 to 4 inches of snow Saturday night and Sunday over the Interior southeast of Delta Junction. Fairbanks can expect about 1 inch of snow Friday night and Saturday. Fairbanks can also expected winds to gust to 30 mph after midnight Friday night through Sunday, and possibly into Monday.
